comments.body: these two errors seem related to .pnpm, so maybe we're not setting up the build correctly? @weswigham

Dunno. Don't think the build has changed much recently... this does look like a normal declaration file error, rather than some kind of build conflict (although, yes, installed at a strange looking path thanks to pnpm)
this looks bad and is not in master

Never mind, I was looking at an old commit. There was a commit 4 days ago that added a couple of `?.` uses. This fails to parse, which makes me think that the TS we're using isn't actually latest. 

@weswigham

2. do you want to merge this in the meantime?
It is now in master, so might as well fix it there.

comments.body: azure-sdk seems to change their build day-to-day, which seems surprising. But if it's true, then I guess the diff is expected.
Because they're legitimately indexing an `enum` with `any`, apparently - `ConditionErrorNameMapper[condition as any]`. Error seems legit to me.
